intro: Rhynchospora rheophytica, commonly known as the streamside spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in shallow, flowing water or moist soils, and its rhizomes help anchor it in these dynamic environments. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family. Rhynchospora rheophytica plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
